DataElement.preferredName: Patient Taxane Compound Platinum Compound Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether the patient's personal medical history of hypersensitivity, an exaggerated response by the immune system to taxane compounds, anticancer drugs that inhibit cancer cell growth by stopping cell division, or  platinum compounds, Inorganic compounds which contain platinum as the central atom.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Taxane Compound Platinum Compound Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's personal medical history of hypersensitivity, an exaggerated response by the immune system to taxane compounds, anticancer drugs that inhibit cancer cell growth by stopping cell division, or  platinum compounds, Inorganic compounds which contain platinum as the central atom.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Taxane Compound Platinum Compound Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Anticancer drugs that inhibit cancer cell growth by stopping cell division. Also called antimitotic or antimicrotubule agents or mitotic inhibitors.:Inorganic compounds which contain platinum as the central atom.:Altered reactivity to an antigen, which can result in pathologic reactions upon subsequent exposure to that particular antigen.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A type of drug that blocks cell growth by stopping mitosis (cell division). Taxanes interfere with microtubules (cellular structures that help move chromosomes during mitosis). They are used to treat cancer. A taxane is a type of mitotic inhibitor and a type of antimicrotubule agent.

A chemotherapy compound that contains a platinum atom. Platinum compounds do not contain alkyl groups but do cause DNA crosslinks and adducts similar to alkylating agents. DNA crosslinks and adducts ultimately lead to the induction of apoptosis.
An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.
